chargeHist.descr: Possession of a Firearm By a Felon
Possession of a Firearm By a Felon

result.execSummary:
The defendant Chase A. Weiner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of a Firearm by a Felon [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
65 days sentence credit if revoked from probation

records.addlTxt: Judgment for unpaid fine/forfeiture/other not sent; no current address.
Notice of Completion of Representation
Reminder Notice regarding court costs amount mailed to Defendant
Same as Complaint
See Plea Hearing docket event for details of waiver

(Case called at 2:19 PM)
Defendant Chase Weiner appears in custody with Attorney Alicia Linzmeier.  Attorney Matthew Kirkpatrick appears for the State of Wisconsin.
State in compliance with victim notification requirements.  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing - waiver accepted by Court.  Defense outlines the agreement for the Court.  Defendant acknowledges the plea questionnaire/waiver of rights form.  Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1: Possession of a Firearm by a Felon (Repeater).  Defendant advised of the elements, maximum possible penalties, and Constitutional rights.  Court accepts plea and finds Defendant guilty of Count 1.  Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.  Parties make statements regarding the agreement.  State indicates that seized firearms may be returned to D.H.  Court withholds sentence and orders 3 years of probation.  Conditions ordered as follows: Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.  No possession of any firearms.  No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in therapeutic setting.  Comply with any counseling/treatment per agent.  Pay court costs, provide DNA sample and pay fee.  Court orders any firearms seized that belong to D.H. shall be returned to D.H.  65 days sentence credit if revoked from probation - to be disputed by DOC if/when probation is revoked.
